loan_programs.name: Super Jumbo
loan_programs.description: Super Jumbo underwriting guidelines for primary residence high-value loans; strict underwriting, minimum FICO 720, max DTI 38%, asset utilization rules, reserves and cash-out limits documented. (Extracted from Super Jumbo Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf)

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: Loans $3.0M–$4.0M: reserves 12 months PITIA per Super Jumbo guidelines. Max DTI 38%. Credit event seasoning > 48 months required.
Loans $4.0M–$5.0M: reserves 18 months PITIA per Super Jumbo guidelines. Cash-out proceeds may not be used to meet reserves.

guidelines.content: Credit Event Seasoning: greater than 48 months required for Super Jumbo loans.
guidelines.sourceReference: Super Jumbo Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'CREDIT EVENT SEASONING' section.

guidelines.content: Maximum DTI: 38% for Super Jumbo loans (Primary Residence only).
guidelines.sourceReference: Super Jumbo Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'MAX DTI' and 'OCCUPANCY' sections.

guidelines.content: Reserves requirements: $3.0M–$4.0M loans require 12 months PITIA; $4.0M–$5.0M loans require 18 months PITIA. Cash-out proceeds may not be used to meet reserves.
guidelines.sourceReference: Super Jumbo Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'RESERVES' section.

guidelines.content: Allowed property types: 1-unit SFD/PUD/Condo (warrantable/non-warrantable). Lot size max 2 acres. Farms/rural properties not permitted.
guidelines.sourceReference: Super Jumbo Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'PROPERTY TYPES' section.

guidelines.content: Gift funds permitted on purchase transactions after 20% minimum borrower contribution and all reserves/prepaids/closing costs met from borrower's own funds.
guidelines.sourceReference: Super Jumbo Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'GIFT FUNDS' section.

guidelines.content: Asset utilization allowed as supplemental income when DTI prior to use of assets is <= 50%. Calculation: qualified assets (sourced & seasoned 3 months) divided by 84 months.
guidelines.sourceReference: Super Jumbo Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'ASSET UTILIZATION AND CALCULATION' section.

guidelines.content: Maximum cash-out (cash in hand): $1,500,000. Cash-out seasoning and ownership rules apply (standard 6-month seasoning unless delayed financing).
guidelines.sourceReference: Super Jumbo Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'CASH OUT LIMITS' and 'DELAYED FINANCING' sections.

guidelines.content: Housing history: 0x30x24 (no 30-day delinquencies in last 24 months). Borrowers who own primary residence free and clear are considered to have acceptable housing history.
guidelines.sourceReference: Super Jumbo Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'HOUSING HISTORY' section.

guidelines.content: Minimum credit score requirement: 720 for all borrowers on the loan. Zero tolerance policy on fraud; ATR and TILA compliance required.
guidelines.sourceReference: Super Jumbo Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'MINIMUM CREDIT SCORE REQUIREMENTS' and 'Zero Tolerance Fraud' sections.

loan_programs.name: Ally | Consumer - No Ratio
loan_programs.description: Ally Consumer - No Ratio (No Income & No Employment) underwriting guidelines — CDFI-exempt program for underbanked / underserved borrowers. (Extracted from Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf)
loan_programs.sourceDocument: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: Max LTV values referenced in program matrices — placeholder 75% used here. Qualify at Promissory Note rate; Impound required; see program matrices for exact LTV per product. Source: Ally No Ratio guidelines.
Second-home LTV placeholder 75%. Actual matrix values to replace when available. Impound required; no prepayment penalty.

Cash-out rules: borrower must have 4 months reserves from own funds; remaining reserves may be satisfied with cash-out proceeds per guidelines. Cash-out seasoning rules apply (no <6 months unless inheritance, etc.). Placeholder LTV 70% - replace with matrix values.

guidelines.content: Minimum loan amount $100,000. Maximum loan amount $2,000,000.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: No prepayment penalty for Ally No Ratio program.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: Eligible occupancy: Primary residences and Second Homes (must be occupied by borrower some portion of year). Investment properties are ineligible under this program.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: Ineligible states: Alabama, Alaska, Arkansas, Kansas, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Missouri, Mississippi, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Mexico, New York, North Dakota, Pennsylvania, South Dakota, West Virginia, Wyoming. CDFI exception not honored in: District of Columbia, Maryland, Maine, Nevada, Pennsylvania, Washington.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: Second appraisal required when loan amount >= $1,500,000. Desk appraisal required for loan amounts < $1,500,000; if desk appraisal is >10% below appraised value, field review or second appraisal required. Appraisals must be <120 days old; original appraisal cannot be older than 365 days as of Promissory Note date.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: Declining market adjustments: Purchase/Rate & Term — 10% reduction to max LTV; Cash Out — 15% reduction to max LTV.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: Tradeline requirement: 2 tradelines reporting for 12+ months OR 1 tradeline reporting for 24+ months; all with activity in last 90 days. First-time homebuyers allowed to apply recent 12-month VOR towards tradeline requirement.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: Foreclosure: 7-year waiting period measured from completion date to disbursement. Bankruptcy: No bankruptcy in previous 4 years (all types) measured from discharge date to disbursement. No short sale or Deed-in-Lieu in the previous 4 years.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: Cash-out refinance: borrower must have 4 months of reserves from their own funds; remaining reserve requirement may be satisfied with cash-out proceeds. All asset statements must be dated within 90 days of the Promissory Note date. Gift funds may not be used for reserves.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: Gift funds acceptable for down payment and closing costs (gift letter required). Gifts MAY NOT be used to meet reserve requirements. Gifts of equity are not permitted.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: Seller credit not to exceed 6% on purchase transactions.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: Eligible properties: Primary residences and second homes; 1-4 unit residential; condos (Fannie Mae warrantable) and site condos allowed; acreage limited to 10 acres max. Ineligible properties: investment, vacant land, manufactured/mobile, coop shares, assisted living facilities, houseboats, acreage >10 acres, properties used for cultivation/distribution/manufacture/sale of marijuana, non-warrantable condotels, C5/C6 condition ratings.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: CDFI exemption: Champions Funding LLC is certified as a CDFI (Cert. #171CE014596). Loans originated while certified are exempt from Ability-to-Repay (ATR) requirements per 12 C.F.R. 1805.104. Qualifying rate rules: Fixed loans qualified at promissory note rate; certain ARMs qualify at note or fully-indexed rate per schedule.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Ally No Ratio Guidelines.pdf

guidelines.content: Colorado requires LO Reasonable Inquiry Attestation and HUD Counseling Certification (CHAC). Iowa min loan $125,000; North Carolina min loan $300,000; Texas 50(a)(6) not permitted.
guidelines.sourceReference: All Matrices.pdf — 'State Specific Restrictions'

loan_programs.name: Activator / Accelerator / Ambassador / ITIN
loan_programs.description: Champions Funding multi-program Non-QM set — includes Activator (Full/Alt Doc), Accelerator (DSCR), Ambassador (Foreign National), and ITIN program options as described in Guidelines 01-21-2025.

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: Per Master Champs Matrices 01-21-2025 — 720+ FICO, 80% LTV Purchase / 70% Cash-out, 12-month reserves.
Per All Matrices PDF — 680 FICO tier, 65% max LTV, 9-month reserves requirement.

guidelines.content: Escrows required for HPML and Flood Insurance; optional otherwise based on program matrices.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'ESCROWS | IMPOUND ACCOUNTS'

guidelines.content: Secondary financing permitted up to combined LTV limits; must be institutional, no seller carrybacks; full subordination docs required.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'SECONDARY FINANCING'

guidelines.content: Eligible borrower types include US Citizens, Permanent Residents, Non-Permanent Residents, ITIN, and Foreign Nationals. Ineligible borrowers include those with diplomatic immunity or on OFAC lists.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'BORROWER ELIGIBILITY'

guidelines.content: Non-arm’s length transactions must be disclosed and justified; family sales, renter purchases, or related-party deals require proof of payments and explanation.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'NON-ARM’S LENGTH AND INTERESTED PARTY TRANSACTIONS'

guidelines.content: Cash-out allowed on properties owned <6 months when purchased with cash; must document original funds and confirm no prior liens.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'DELAYED FINANCING'

guidelines.content: Lease with Purchase Option allowed with verified 12-month rent history and earnest deposit ≥3%. Appraised value used for LTV when >12 months occupancy.
guidelines.sourceReference: Champions Funding LLC - Guidelines 01-21-2025.pdf — 'LEASE WITH PURCHASE OPTION'

loan_programs.name: Flex Select (Express DU option)
loan_programs.description: Flex Select program including Express DU (AUS) option. DU-specific overlays: max DTI, DU eligible findings, non-occupant co-borrower rules, and DU reserve matrix references.

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: Express DU: Max DTI = 50%. DU findings limited to Approve/Eligible and Approve/Ineligible (ineligible only for loan size/LTV/features, not credit events). Appraisal waiver not eligible; appraisal/review products required. See Flex Select Matrix for precise LTVs/reserves.

Non-occupant co-borrower (DU) rules: allowed for Primary occupancy only; max 90% LTV; blended ratios permitted to max 50% DTI; max loan amount for non-occupant co-borrower scenarios = $1,000,000. Use primary wage earner credit score for qualifying.

guidelines.content: Express DU / AUS rules: DU findings must be Approve/Eligible or Approve/Ineligible per guidelines. Extenuating circumstance overrides not permitted. Housing history 0x30x12; appraisal waiver not eligible; all files require appraisal +/- review or 2 appraisals depending on loan amount.
guidelines.sourceReference: FLEX GUIDELINES - 'FLEX SELECT EXPRESS DU OPTION'.

loan_programs.name: Select ITIN
loan_programs.description: Standalone Select ITIN program matrix extracted from Flex Select (requirements and eligible docs updated 01-20-2025).

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: Select ITIN Primary Full Doc Purchase up to 85% LTV (Full Doc only for max 85% LTV on 1-unit SFR/PUD/TH). Alt Doc lower LTVs — see matrix for alt doc bands.
Select ITIN cash-out bands: see matrix for 2.0M–2.5M bands and alt doc differences. 6-month seasoning required for cash-out.

guidelines.content: Select ITIN matrix: ITIN requirements separated from Flex Select; refer to Select ITIN Program Matrix for exact LTVs, docs, and allowable occupancy. (Matrix values to be pulled from All Matrices.), ITIN borrowers: ITIN must be assigned prior to application; min 2 years consistent ITIN payments reporting; primary borrower should be ITIN borrower. Escrow impounds required. See Select ITIN documentation requirements.
guidelines.sourceReference: FLEX GUIDELINES - 'Select - ITIN — Extracted requirements'.

loan_programs.name: DSCR Supreme
loan_programs.description: New DSCR Supreme program (competitively priced DSCR product for qualified investors) — highlights and overlays included; matrix defines LTV/reserves.

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: DSCR Supreme: Min DSCR 1.00 (first time investor min DSCR 1.25). Max LTV per DSCR Matrix = 80% highlighted; max cash-out $1,000,000 (>=6 months seasoning), reserves: <=$500k => 3 months; >$500k => 6 months. Replace reserves/LTV with matrix exact values.

guidelines.content: DSCR Supreme highlights: DSCR min 1.00; first time investor DSCR min 1.25; housing history 0x30x12; max cash-out $1,000,000 with 6+ months seasoning; reserves per program matrix.
guidelines.sourceReference: FLEX GUIDELINES - 'DSCR SUPREME — Program Highlights'.

loan_programs.name: Closed End Second Lien
loan_programs.description: Closed End 2nd Lien program rules (terms, amounts, ineligible thresholds and high-cost thresholds).

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: Second-lien program: allowed terms 15/20/25/30 years; not assumable; TPO must be approved to deliver second liens. High-cost second liens allowed in limited circumstances with Section 32 disclosure and compliance. See program section for HPML and state-specific rules.

guidelines.content: Closed End Second Lien highlights: Min loan $125k; Max loan $500k; Primary and Second Homes allowed; Simultaneous second liens allowed when HCLTV <= matrix caps (most restrictive of 1st/2nd lien matrices).
guidelines.sourceReference: FLEX GUIDELINES - 'CLOSED END SECOND LIEN PROGRAM'.

loan_programs.name: DSCR Multi & Mixed
loan_programs.description: DSCR Multi & Mixed (formerly DSCR 5-10 units residential & 2-8 mixed-use) — updated matrix and product rules.

guidelines.content: DSCR Multi & Mixed: Property rental income documentation, investor experience requirement, housing history and appraisal requirements have program-specific rules (see DSCR Multi & Mixed section and program matrix).
guidelines.sourceReference: FLEX GUIDELINES - 'DSCR MULTI & MIXED' sections.

loan_programs.name: Flex Supreme
loan_programs.description: Flex Supreme program matrix and overlays (Primary / Second Home / Investment) — per Combined Matrices 01-20-2025.

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: Flex Supreme Primary: 740 / max loan 2,500,000 => Purchase LTV 80, Cash-Out 65. See matrix for other bands and 3/2/1k amounts.
700 band example: 2,000,000 -> Purchase LTV 80 (see full matrix). FTHB overlays: max DTI 43% and I/O not permitted for FTHB. Declining market LTV -5%.

guidelines.content: Reserves: <= $500,000 = 3 months; >$500k–$1.5M = 6 months; >$1.5M–$2.5M = 9 months; >$2.5M–$3.0M = 12 months. Cash-out proceeds may be used to satisfy reserves (Flex Supreme matrix rules).
guidelines.sourceReference: Flex Supreme Matrix — reserves table. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

guidelines.content: Cash-out: min 6 months seasoning. If LTV <= 70% = unlimited cash-in; if LTV > 70% = max $500,000. Cash-Out not permitted in Declining Markets.
guidelines.sourceReference: Flex Supreme Matrix — Cash-Out rules. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

loan_programs.name: Flex Select (Delegated Correspondent)
loan_programs.description: Flex Select Delegated Correspondent matrix (includes wider property types: non-warrantable condos, manufactured housing, condotels — with specific limits).

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: Flex Select delegated: 760 band -> Purchase LTV up to 90% for OO (per matrix). Condos allowed (warrantable/non-warrantable) — see Condo LTV exceptions.
eligibility_matrix_rules.sourceReference: Flex Select Matrix (Delegated) — score band rows. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: 700 band example: Purchase LTV 85% on lower loan amounts. LTV reductions apply for certain loan sizes and documentation types. See matrix for full banding.
eligibility_matrix_rules.sourceReference: Flex Select Matrix (Delegated) — score band rows. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

guidelines.content: Express DU (AUS) allowed ONLY under Flex Select; eligible findings Approve/Eligible and Approve/Ineligible. Max DTI 50% (50% DU limit). Non-occupant co-borrower rules: blend ratios up to 50% DTI, max loan amount for non-occupant scenarios = $1,000,000.
guidelines.sourceReference: Flex Select / Express DU rules. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

guidelines.content: Cash-out: if LTV <= 60% = unlimited; if LTV > 60% = max $1,000,000 unless 18 months additional reserves (then unlimited). Condos cash-out max 75% LTV.
guidelines.sourceReference: Flex Select Matrix — cash-out rules. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

loan_programs.name: Edge DSCR
loan_programs.description: Edge DSCR program (business purpose / investment properties). Manual underwriting; min FICO 700; min payment history 1x30x12; min DSCR 0.80 (matrix dependent); reserves and LTV per matrix.

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: Edge DSCR: 700 FICO, $3,000,000 max -> Purchase LTV 70%. (Matrix row).
eligibility_matrix_rules.sourceReference: Edge DSCR LTV Matrix (Edge & Access DSCR Product Matrix). :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: Edge DSCR: 700 FICO, $2,000,000 -> Purchase LTV 75%. (Matrix row).
Edge DSCR: 720 band cash-out LTV 70% (matrix footnotes apply). Cash-out when LTV >65%: max $1,000,000 cash-in-hand. See matrix footnotes for condo/condotel exceptions and IO DSCR requirements.
eligibility_matrix_rules.sourceReference: Edge DSCR LTV Matrix and LTV footnotes.

guidelines.content: Edge DSCR highlights: Min FICO 700, payment history 1x30x12 on subject and primary residence, Interest-Only loans require DSCR >= 1.00, First Time Investors require DSCR > 1.00. Short-term rentals: special DSCR minimums (matrix footnotes).
guidelines.sourceReference: Edge & Access DSCR Product Matrix — program highlights and footnotes. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

guidelines.content: Reserve requirements (PITIA-based): Loan < $1,000,000 => 3 months; Loan > $1,000,000 to < $1,500,000 => 6 months; Loan > $1,500,000 => 9 months. Cash-out funds may be used for reserves. (Edge program minimum reserve = 3 months).
guidelines.sourceReference: Edge & Access DSCR Product Matrix — Reserve Requirements. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}

guidelines.content: Appraisals: One appraisal required for loans < $2,000,000; two appraisals required for loans > $2,000,000. For 1-unit properties include Form 1007; for 2-4 units use Form 1025. Collateral review and SSR thresholds per guide.
guidelines.sourceReference: Edge & Access DSCR Product Matrix — Appraisal Requirements; Arc Underwriting Guide for collateral reviews.

guidelines.content: Eligible: 1-4 units, PUD, warrantable and non-warrantable condos, condotels (with limits), rural up to 20 acres. Ineligible: mixed-use properties. Condotel and non-warrantable condo LTV caps apply (see matrix footnotes).
guidelines.sourceReference: Edge & Access DSCR Product Matrix — Property Types & footnotes. :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}

loan_programs.name: Access DSCR
loan_programs.description: Access DSCR program (business purpose / investment properties) — wider FICO acceptance (min 640), lower DSCR floor allowed by band; reserves and LTV per Access matrix.

eligibility_matrix_rules.notes: Access DSCR: DSCR >=1.06 with min 740 FICO -> $2.5M max -> Purchase LTV 70% (matrix).
Access DSCR: 720 band -> $2,000,000 -> Purchase LTV 75% (matrix).
Access DSCR: 660 band -> $1,000,000 -> Cash-out LTV 65% (matrix). Cash-out limits: <60% LTV unlimited cash-in; >60% LTV max $500,000 cash-in-hand (matrix footnote).
eligibility_matrix_rules.sourceReference: Access DSCR LTV Matrix and footnotes.

guidelines.content: Access DSCR highlights: Min FICO 640, payment history 0x30x12, DSCR minimums per matrix (some bands require >=1.25 for short-term rentals when LTV > 75%); Interest-Only loans require DSCR > 1.00 for many bands.
guidelines.sourceReference: Access DSCR Product Matrix — program highlights and footnotes. :contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}

guidelines.content: Reserve table (PITIA-based): Loan $125K–$500K and <=70% LTV => 3 months; $125K–$500K and >70% LTV => 6 months; Loan > $500K => 6 months. Cash-out funds allowed to satisfy reserves.
guidelines.sourceReference: Edge & Access DSCR Product Matrix — Reserve Requirements. :contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}

guidelines.content: Appraisal rules: One appraisal for loans < $2M; two appraisals for > $2M; Form 1007 required for 1-unit appraisals; 1025 for 2-4 units. Appraisal Review Product/order when SSR > 2.5 (except where full second appraisal ordered).
guidelines.sourceReference: Edge & Access DSCR Product Matrix — Appraisal Requirements; Arc Underwriting Guide.

guidelines.content: Access cash-out rules: <60% LTV => unlimited cash-in; >60% LTV => max $500,000 cash-in-hand. Cash-out refinances for properties acquired in past 12 months require minimum DSCR 0.75 (matrix).
guidelines.sourceReference: Access DSCR LTV Matrix footnotes and Combined Matrices.

guidelines.content: Eligible borrowers: US citizens, permanent and non-permanent resident aliens, LLCs/corporations (entity vesting rules apply); First Time Investors allowed with min 700 FICO and min 1.00 DSCR (matrix). Foreign Nationals and certain entity POA uses are restricted per Arc Guide.
guidelines.sourceReference: Edge & Access DSCR Product Matrix and Arc Underwriting Guide — borrower eligibility.
